question.content:
Sushma buys a galvanometer to measure current in a circuit. She takes the galvanometer out of the box and sees that the maximum reading on the galvanometer is much less than the current she needs to measure.

**Which of these best describes the resistor she needs to attach to the galvanometer to measure the current in the circuit?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.clue: A resistor in series will distribute potential between the galvanometer and the resistor. But, we need to distribute the current. We want the galvanometer to receive a small portion of the current.

Since the galvanometer shows maximum deflection for a small current, we need to ensure that only a small portion of the current passes through it. A small resistor in parallel will divide the current and ensure that most of the current passes through the attached resistor.
A resistor in series will distribute potential between the galvanometer and the resistor. But, we need to distribute the current. We want the galvanometer to receive a small portion of the current.

A resistor in parallel will divide current, BUT a large resistor will allow very little current to flow through it. Most of the current will still flow through the galvanometer. We want the galvanometer to receive a small portion of the current.
